00611 // constructor: set a style during construction
00612 //
00613 inline Gnuplot::Gnuplot(const std::string &style)
00614                            :gnucmd(NULL) ,valid(false) ,two_dim(false) ,nplots(0)
00615 
00616 {
00617     init();
00618     set_style(style);
00619 }
00620   
00621 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00622 //
00623 // constructor: open a new session, plot a signal (x)
00624 //
00625 inline Gnuplot::Gnuplot(const std::vector<double> &x,
00626                  const std::string &title,
00627                  const std::string &style,
00628                  const std::string &labelx,
00629                  const std::string &labely)
00630                            :gnucmd(NULL) ,valid(false) ,two_dim(false) ,nplots(0)
00631 {
00632     init();
00633 
00634     set_style(style);
00635     set_xlabel(labelx);
00636     set_ylabel(labely);
00637 
00638     plot_x(x,title);
00639 }

00689 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00690 //
00692 //
00693 template<typename X>
00694 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::plot_x(const X& x, const std::string &title)
00695 {
00696     if (x.size() == 0)
00697     {
00698         throw GnuplotException("std::vector too small");
00699         return *this;
00700     }
00701 
00702     std::ofstream tmp;
00703     std::string name = create_tmpfile(tmp);
00704     if (name == "")
00705         return *this;
00706 
00707     //
00708     // write the data to file
00709     //
00710     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < x.size(); i++)
00711         tmp << x[i] << std::endl;
00712 
00713     tmp.flush();
00714     tmp.close();
00715 
00716 
00717     plotfile_x(name, 1, title);
00718 
00719     return *this;
00720 }
00721 
00722   
00723 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00724 //
00726 //
00727 template<typename X, typename Y>
00728 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::plot_xy(const X& x, const Y& y, const std::string &title)
00729 {
00730     if (x.size() == 0 || y.size() == 0)
00731     {
00732         throw GnuplotException("std::vectors too small");
00733         return *this;
00734     }
00735 
00736     if (x.size() != y.size())
00737     {
00738         throw GnuplotException("Length of the std::vectors differs");
00739         return *this;
00740     }
00741 
00742 
00743     std::ofstream tmp;
00744     std::string name = create_tmpfile(tmp);
00745     if (name == "")
00746         return *this;
00747 
00748     //
00749     // write the data to file
00750     //
00751     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < x.size(); i++)
00752         tmp << x[i] << " " << y[i] << std::endl;
00753 
00754     tmp.flush();
00755     tmp.close();
00756 
00757 
00758     plotfile_xy(name, 1, 2, title);
00759 
00760     return *this;
00761 }
00762 
00767 template<typename X, typename Y, typename E>
00768 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::plot_xy_err(const X &x,
00769                               const Y &y,
00770                               const E &dy,
00771                               const std::string &title)
00772 {
00773     if (x.size() == 0 || y.size() == 0 || dy.size() == 0)
00774     {
00775         throw GnuplotException("std::vectors too small");
00776         return *this;
00777     }
00778 
00779     if (x.size() != y.size() || y.size() != dy.size())
00780     {
00781         throw GnuplotException("Length of the std::vectors differs");
00782         return *this;
00783     }
00784 
00785 
00786     std::ofstream tmp;
00787     std::string name = create_tmpfile(tmp);
00788     if (name == "")
00789         return *this;
00790 
00791     //
00792     // write the data to file
00793     //
00794     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < x.size(); i++)
00795         tmp << x[i] << " " << y[i] << " " << dy[i] << std::endl;
00796 
00797     tmp.flush();
00798     tmp.close();
00799 
00800 
00801     // Do the actual plot
00802     plotfile_xy_err(name, 1, 2, 3, title);
00803 
00804     return *this;
00805 }
00806

00808 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00809 //
00810 // Plots a 3d graph from a list of doubles: x y z
00811 //
00812 template<typename X, typename Y, typename Z>
00813 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::plot_xyz(const X &x,
00814                            const Y &y,
00815                            const Z &z,
00816                            const std::string &title)
00817 {
00818     if (x.size() == 0 || y.size() == 0 || z.size() == 0)
00819     {
00820         throw GnuplotException("std::vectors too small");
00821         return *this;
00822     }
00823 
00824     if (x.size() != y.size() || x.size() != z.size())
00825     {
00826         throw GnuplotException("Length of the std::vectors differs");
00827         return *this;
00828     }
00829 
00830 
00831     std::ofstream tmp;
00832     std::string name = create_tmpfile(tmp);
00833     if (name == "")
00834         return *this;
00835 
00836     //
00837     // write the data to file
00838     //
00839     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < x.size(); i++)
00840         tmp << x[i] << " " << y[i] << " " << z[i] <<std::endl;
00841 
00842     tmp.flush();
00843     tmp.close();
00844 
00845 
00846     plotfile_xyz(name, 1, 2, 3, title);
00847 
00848     return *this;
00849 }

00851 
00852 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00853 //
00854 // define static member function: set Gnuplot path manual
00855 //   for windows: path with slash '/' not backslash '\'
00856 //
00857 bool Gnuplot::set_GNUPlotPath(const std::string &path)
00858 {
00859 
00860     std::string tmp = path + "/" + Gnuplot::m_sGNUPlotFileName;
00861 
00862 
00863 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(__TOS_WIN__)
00864     if ( Gnuplot::file_exists(tmp,0) ) // check existence
00865 #elif defined(unix) || defined(__unix) || defined(__unix__) || defined(__APPLE__)
00866     if ( Gnuplot::file_exists(tmp,1) ) // check existence and execution permission
00867 #endif
00868     {
00869         Gnuplot::m_sGNUPlotPath = path;
00870         return true;
00871     }
00872     else
00873     {
00874         Gnuplot::m_sGNUPlotPath.clear();
00875         return false;
00876     }
00877 }

00880 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00881 //
00882 // define static member function: set standart terminal, used by showonscreen
00883 //  defaults: Windows - win, Linux - x11, Mac - aqua
00884 //
00885 void Gnuplot::set_terminal_std(const std::string &type)
00886 {
00887 #if defined(unix) || defined(__unix) || defined(__unix__) || defined(__APPLE__)
00888     if (type.find("x11") != std::string::npos && getenv("DISPLAY") == NULL)
00889     {
00890         throw GnuplotException("Can't find DISPLAY variable");
00891     }
00892 #endif
00893 
00894 
00895     Gnuplot::terminal_std = type;
00896     return;
00897 }
00898 
00899 
00900 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00901 //
00902 // A string tokenizer taken from http://www.sunsite.ualberta.ca/Documentation/
00903 // /Gnu/libstdc++-2.90.8/html/21_strings/stringtok_std_h.txt
00904 //
00905 template <typename Container>
00906 void stringtok (Container &container,
00907                 std::string const &in,
00908                 const char * const delimiters = " \t\n")
00909 {
00910     const std::string::size_type len = in.length();
00911           std::string::size_type i = 0;
00912 
00913     while ( i < len )
00914     {
00915         // eat leading whitespace
00916         i = in.find_first_not_of (delimiters, i);
00917 
00918         if (i == std::string::npos)
00919             return;   // nothing left but white space
00920 
00921         // find the end of the token
00922         std::string::size_type j = in.find_first_of (delimiters, i);
00923 
00924         // push token
00925         if (j == std::string::npos)
00926         {
00927             container.push_back (in.substr(i));
00928             return;
00929         }
00930         else
00931             container.push_back (in.substr(i, j-i));
00932 
00933         // set up for next loop
00934         i = j + 1;
00935     }
00936 
00937     return;
00938 }
00939 
00940 
00941 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00942 //
00943 // Destructor: needed to delete temporary files
00944 //
00945 Gnuplot::~Gnuplot()
00946 {
00947 //  remove_tmpfiles();
00948 
00949     // A stream opened by popen() should be closed by pclose()
00950 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(__TOS_WIN__)
00951     if (_pclose(gnucmd) == -1)
00952 #elif defined(unix) || defined(__unix) || defined(__unix__) || defined(__APPLE__)
00953     if (pclose(gnucmd) == -1)
00954 #endif
00955         throw GnuplotException("Problem closing communication to gnuplot");
00956 }
00957 
00958 
00959 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00960 //
00961 // Resets a gnuplot session (next plot will erase previous ones)
00962 //
00963 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::reset_plot()
00964 {
00965 //  remove_tmpfiles();
00966 
00967     nplots = 0;
00968 
00969     return *this;
00970 }
00971 
00972 
00973 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00974 //
00975 // resets a gnuplot session and sets all varibles to default
00976 //
00977 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::reset_all()
00978 {
00979 //  remove_tmpfiles();
00980 
00981     nplots = 0;
00982     cmd("reset");
00983     cmd("clear");
00984     pstyle = "points";
00985     smooth = "";
00986     showonscreen();
00987 
00988     return *this;
00989 }
00990 
00991 
00992 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00993 //
00994 // Change the plotting style of a gnuplot session
00995 //
00996 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::set_style(const std::string &stylestr)
00997 {
00998     if (stylestr.find("lines")          == std::string::npos  &&
00999         stylestr.find("points")         == std::string::npos  &&
01000         stylestr.find("linespoints")    == std::string::npos  &&
01001         stylestr.find("impulses")       == std::string::npos  &&
01002         stylestr.find("dots")           == std::string::npos  &&
01003         stylestr.find("steps")          == std::string::npos  &&
01004         stylestr.find("fsteps")         == std::string::npos  &&
01005         stylestr.find("histeps")        == std::string::npos  &&
01006         stylestr.find("boxes")          == std::string::npos  &&  // 1-4 columns of data are required
01007         stylestr.find("filledcurves")   == std::string::npos  &&
01008         stylestr.find("histograms")     == std::string::npos  )   //only for one data column
01009 //        stylestr.find("labels")         == std::string::npos  &&  // 3 columns of data are required
01010 //        stylestr.find("xerrorbars")     == std::string::npos  &&  // 3-4 columns of data are required
01011 //        stylestr.find("xerrorlines")    == std::string::npos  &&  // 3-4 columns of data are required
01012 //        stylestr.find("errorbars")      == std::string::npos  &&  // 3-4 columns of data are required
01013 //        stylestr.find("errorlines")     == std::string::npos  &&  // 3-4 columns of data are required
01014 //        stylestr.find("yerrorbars")     == std::string::npos  &&  // 3-4 columns of data are required
01015 //        stylestr.find("yerrorlines")    == std::string::npos  &&  // 3-4 columns of data are required
01016 //        stylestr.find("boxerrorbars")   == std::string::npos  &&  // 3-5 columns of data are required
01017 //        stylestr.find("xyerrorbars")    == std::string::npos  &&  // 4,6,7 columns of data are required
01018 //        stylestr.find("xyerrorlines")   == std::string::npos  &&  // 4,6,7 columns of data are required
01019 //        stylestr.find("boxxyerrorbars") == std::string::npos  &&  // 4,6,7 columns of data are required
01020 //        stylestr.find("financebars")    == std::string::npos  &&  // 5 columns of data are required
01021 //        stylestr.find("candlesticks")   == std::string::npos  &&  // 5 columns of data are required
01022 //        stylestr.find("vectors")        == std::string::npos  &&
01023 //        stylestr.find("image")          == std::string::npos  &&
01024 //        stylestr.find("rgbimage")       == std::string::npos  &&
01025 //        stylestr.find("pm3d")           == std::string::npos  )
01026     {
01027         pstyle = std::string("points");
01028     }
01029     else
01030     {
01031         pstyle = stylestr;
01032     }
01033 
01034     return *this;
01035 }
01036 
01037 
01038 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01039 //
01040 // smooth: interpolation and approximation of data
01041 //
01042 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::set_smooth(const std::string &stylestr)
01043 {
01044     if (stylestr.find("unique")    == std::string::npos  &&
01045         stylestr.find("frequency") == std::string::npos  &&
01046         stylestr.find("csplines")  == std::string::npos  &&
01047         stylestr.find("acsplines") == std::string::npos  &&
01048         stylestr.find("bezier")    == std::string::npos  &&
01049         stylestr.find("sbezier")   == std::string::npos  )
01050     {
01051         smooth = "";
01052     }
01053     else
01054     {
01055         smooth = stylestr;
01056     }
01057 
01058     return *this;
01059 }
01060 
01061 
01062 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01063 //
01064 // sets terminal type to windows / x11
01065 //
01066 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::showonscreen()
01067 {
01068     cmd("set output");
01069     cmd("set terminal " + Gnuplot::terminal_std);
01070 
01071     return *this;
01072 }

01076 // saves a gnuplot session to a postscript file
01077 //
01078 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::savetops(const std::string &filename)
01079 {
01080     cmd("set terminal postscript color");
01081 
01082     std::ostringstream cmdstr;
01083     cmdstr << "set output \"" << filename << ".ps\"";
01084     cmd(cmdstr.str());
01085 
01086     return *this;
01087 }

01186 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01187 //
01188 // enables contour drawing for surfaces set contour {base | surface | both}
01189 //
01190 
01191 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::set_contour(const std::string &position)
01192 {
01193     if (position.find("base")    == std::string::npos  &&
01194         position.find("surface") == std::string::npos  &&
01195         position.find("both")    == std::string::npos  )
01196     {
01197         cmd("set contour base");
01198     }
01199     else
01200     {
01201         cmd("set contour " + position);
01202     }
01203 
01204     return *this;
01205 }

01307 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01308 //
01309 // Plots a linear equation y=ax+b (where you supply the
01310 // slope a and intercept b)
01311 //
01312 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::plot_slope(const double a,
01313                              const double b,
01314                              const std::string &title)
01315 {
01316     std::ostringstream cmdstr;
01317     //
01318     // command to be sent to gnuplot
01319     //
01320     if (nplots > 0  &&  two_dim == true)
01321         cmdstr << "replot ";
01322     else
01323         cmdstr << "plot ";
01324 
01325     cmdstr << a << " * x + " << b << " title \"";
01326 
01327     if (title == "")
01328         cmdstr << "f(x) = " << a << " * x + " << b;
01329     else
01330         cmdstr << title;
01331 
01332     cmdstr << "\" with " << pstyle;
01333 
01334     //
01335     // Do the actual plot
01336     //
01337     cmd(cmdstr.str());
01338 
01339     return *this;
01340 }
01341 
01342 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01343 //
01344 // Plot an equation supplied as a std::string y=f(x) (only f(x) expected)
01345 //
01346 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::plot_equation(const std::string &equation,
01347                                 const std::string &title)
01348 {
01349     std::ostringstream cmdstr;
01350     //
01351     // command to be sent to gnuplot
01352     //
01353     if (nplots > 0  &&  two_dim == true)
01354         cmdstr << "replot ";
01355     else
01356         cmdstr << "plot ";
01357 
01358     cmdstr << equation << " title \"";
01359 
01360     if (title == "")
01361         cmdstr << "f(x) = " << equation;
01362     else
01363         cmdstr << title;
01364 
01365     cmdstr << "\" with " << pstyle;
01366 
01367     //
01368     // Do the actual plot
01369     //
01370     cmd(cmdstr.str());
01371 
01372     return *this;
01373 }

01376 //
01377 // plot an equation supplied as a std::string y=(x)
01378 //
01379 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::plot_equation3d(const std::string &equation,
01380                                   const std::string &title)
01381 {
01382     std::ostringstream cmdstr;
01383     //
01384     // command to be sent to gnuplot
01385     //
01386     if (nplots > 0  &&  two_dim == false)
01387         cmdstr << "replot ";
01388     else
01389         cmdstr << "splot ";
01390 
01391     cmdstr << equation << " title \"";
01392 
01393     if (title == "")
01394         cmdstr << "f(x,y) = " << equation;
01395     else
01396         cmdstr << title;
01397 
01398     cmdstr << "\" with " << pstyle;
01399 
01400     //
01401     // Do the actual plot
01402     //
01403     cmd(cmdstr.str());
01404 
01405     return *this;
01406 }

01409 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01410 //
01411 // Plots a 2d graph from a list of doubles (x) saved in a file
01412 //
01413 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::plotfile_x(const std::string &filename,
01414                              const unsigned int column,
01415                              const std::string &title)
01416 {
01417     //
01418     // check if file exists
01419     //
01420     file_available(filename);
01421 
01422 
01423     std::ostringstream cmdstr;
01424     //
01425     // command to be sent to gnuplot
01426     //
01427     if (nplots > 0  &&  two_dim == true)
01428         cmdstr << "replot ";
01429     else
01430         cmdstr << "plot ";
01431 
01432     cmdstr << "\"" << filename << "\" using " << column;
01433 
01434     if (title == "")
01435         cmdstr << " notitle ";
01436     else
01437         cmdstr << " title \"" << title << "\" ";
01438 
01439     if(smooth == "")
01440         cmdstr << "with " << pstyle;
01441     else
01442         cmdstr << "smooth " << smooth;
01443 
01444     //
01445     // Do the actual plot
01446     //
01447     cmd(cmdstr.str()); //nplots++; two_dim = true;  already in cmd();
01448 
01449     return *this;
01450 }
01451 
01452 
01453 
01454 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01455 //
01456 // Plots a 2d graph from a list of doubles (x y) saved in a file
01457 //
01458 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::plotfile_xy(const std::string &filename,
01459                               const unsigned int column_x,
01460                               const unsigned int column_y,
01461                               const std::string &title)
01462 {
01463     //
01464     // check if file exists
01465     //
01466     file_available(filename);
01467 
01468 
01469     std::ostringstream cmdstr;
01470     //
01471     // command to be sent to gnuplot
01472     //
01473     if (nplots > 0  &&  two_dim == true)
01474         cmdstr << "replot ";
01475     else
01476         cmdstr << "plot ";
01477 
01478     cmdstr << "\"" << filename << "\" using " << column_x << ":" << column_y;
01479 
01480     if (title == "")
01481         cmdstr << " notitle ";
01482     else
01483         cmdstr << " title \"" << title << "\" ";
01484 
01485     if(smooth == "")
01486         cmdstr << "with " << pstyle;
01487     else
01488         cmdstr << "smooth " << smooth;
01489 
01490     //
01491     // Do the actual plot
01492     //
01493     cmd(cmdstr.str());
01494 
01495     return *this;
01496 }

01499 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01500 //
01501 // Plots a 2d graph with errorbars from a list of doubles (x y dy) in a file
01502 //
01503 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::plotfile_xy_err(const std::string &filename,
01504                                   const unsigned int column_x,
01505                                   const unsigned int column_y,
01506                                   const unsigned int column_dy,
01507                                   const std::string &title)
01508 {

01510     // check if file exists
01511     //
01512     file_available(filename);
01513 
01514     std::ostringstream cmdstr;
01515     //
01516     // command to be sent to gnuplot
01517     //
01518     if (nplots > 0  &&  two_dim == true)
01519         cmdstr << "replot ";
01520     else
01521         cmdstr << "plot ";
01522 
01523     cmdstr << "\"" << filename << "\" using " 
01524            << column_x << ":" << column_y << ":" << column_dy 
01525            << " with errorbars ";
01526 
01527     if (title == "")
01528         cmdstr << " notitle ";
01529     else
01530         cmdstr << " title \"" << title << "\" ";
01531 
01532     //
01533     // Do the actual plot
01534     //
01535     cmd(cmdstr.str());
01536 
01537     return *this;

01541 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01542 //
01543 // Plots a 3d graph from a list of doubles (x y z) saved in a file
01544 //
01545 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::plotfile_xyz(const std::string &filename,
01546                                const unsigned int column_x,
01547                                const unsigned int column_y,
01548                                const unsigned int column_z,
01549                                const std::string &title)
01550 {
01551     //
01552     // check if file exists
01553     //
01554     file_available(filename);
01555 
01556     std::ostringstream cmdstr;
01557     //
01558     // command to be sent to gnuplot
01559     //
01560     if (nplots > 0  &&  two_dim == false)
01561         cmdstr << "replot ";
01562     else
01563         cmdstr << "splot ";
01564 
01565     cmdstr << "\"" << filename << "\" using " << column_x << ":" << column_y 
01566            << ":" << column_z;
01567 
01568     if (title == "")
01569         cmdstr << " notitle with " << pstyle;
01570     else
01571         cmdstr << " title \"" << title << "\" with " << pstyle;
01572 
01573     //
01574     // Do the actual plot
01575     //
01576     cmd(cmdstr.str());
01577 
01578     return *this;
01579 }

01582 
01583 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01584 //
01586 //
01587 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::plot_image(const unsigned char * ucPicBuf,
01588                              const unsigned int iWidth,
01589                              const unsigned int iHeight,
01590                              const std::string &title)
01591 {
01592     std::ofstream tmp;
01593     std::string name = create_tmpfile(tmp);
01594     if (name == "")
01595         return *this;
01596 
01597     //
01598     // write the data to file
01599     //
01600     int iIndex = 0;
01601     for(unsigned int iRow = 0; iRow < iHeight; iRow++)
01602     {
01603         for(unsigned int iColumn = 0; iColumn < iWidth; iColumn++)
01604         {
01605             tmp << iColumn << " " << iRow  << " " 
01606                 << static_cast<float>(ucPicBuf[iIndex++]) << std::endl;
01607         }
01608     }
01609 
01610     tmp.flush();
01611     tmp.close();
01612 
01613 
01614     std::ostringstream cmdstr;
01615     //
01616     // command to be sent to gnuplot
01617     //
01618     if (nplots > 0  &&  two_dim == true)
01619         cmdstr << "replot ";
01620     else
01621         cmdstr << "plot ";
01622 
01623     if (title == "")
01624         cmdstr << "\"" << name << "\" with image";
01625     else
01626         cmdstr << "\"" << name << "\" title \"" << title << "\" with image";
01627 
01628     //
01629     // Do the actual plot
01630     //
01631     cmd(cmdstr.str());
01632 
01633     return *this;
01634 }
01635 
01636 
01637 
01638 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01639 //
01640 // Sends a command to an active gnuplot session
01641 //
01642 Gnuplot& Gnuplot::cmd(const std::string &cmdstr)
01643 {
01644     if( !(valid) )
01645     {
01646         return *this;
01647     }
01648 
01649 
01650     // int fputs ( const char * str, FILE * stream );
01651     // writes the string str to the stream.
01652     // The function begins copying from the address specified (str) until it 
01653     // reaches the terminating null character ('\0'). This final 
01654     // null-character is not copied to the stream.
01655     fputs( (cmdstr+"\n").c_str(), gnucmd );
01656 
01657     // int fflush ( FILE * stream );
01658     // If the given stream was open for writing and the last i/o operation was 
01659     // an output operation, any unwritten data in the output buffer is written 
01660     // to the file.  If the argument is a null pointer, all open files are 
01661     // flushed.  The stream remains open after this call.
01662     fflush(gnucmd);
01663 
01664 
01665     if( cmdstr.find("replot") != std::string::npos )
01666     {
01667         return *this;
01668     }
01669     else if( cmdstr.find("splot") != std::string::npos )
01670     {
01671         two_dim = false;
01672         nplots++;
01673     }
01674     else if( cmdstr.find("plot") != std::string::npos )
01675     {
01676         two_dim = true;
01677         nplots++;
01678     }
01679 
01680     return *this;
01681 }
01682 
01683 
01684 
01685 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01686 //
01687 // Opens up a gnuplot session, ready to receive commands
01688 //
01689 void Gnuplot::init()
01690 {
01691     // char * getenv ( const char * name );  get value of environment variable
01692     // Retrieves a C string containing the value of the environment variable 
01693     // whose name is specified as argument.  If the requested variable is not 
01694     // part of the environment list, the function returns a NULL pointer.
01695 #if ( defined(unix) || defined(__unix) || defined(__unix__) ) && !defined(__APPLE__)
01696     if (getenv("DISPLAY") == NULL)
01697     {
01698         valid = false;
01699         throw GnuplotException("Can't find DISPLAY variable");
01700     }
01701 #endif
01702 
01703 
01704     // if gnuplot not available
01705     if (!Gnuplot::get_program_path())
01706     {
01707         valid = false;
01708         throw GnuplotException("Can't find gnuplot");
01709     }
01710 
01711 
01712     //
01713     // open pipe
01714     //
01715     std::string tmp = Gnuplot::m_sGNUPlotPath + "/" + 
01716         Gnuplot::m_sGNUPlotFileName;
01717 
01718     // FILE *popen(const char *command, const char *mode);
01719     // The popen() function shall execute the command specified by the string 
01720     // command, create a pipe between the calling program and the executed 
01721     // command, and return a pointer to a stream that can be used to either read
01722     // from or write to the pipe.
01723 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(__TOS_WIN__)
01724     gnucmd = _popen(tmp.c_str(),"w");
01725 #elif defined(unix) || defined(__unix) || defined(__unix__) || defined(__APPLE__)
01726     gnucmd = popen(tmp.c_str(),"w");
01727 #endif
01728 
01729     // popen() shall return a pointer to an open stream that can be used to read
01730     // or write to the pipe.  Otherwise, it shall return a null pointer and may 
01731     // set errno to indicate the error.
01732     if (!gnucmd)
01733     {
01734         valid = false;
01735         throw GnuplotException("Couldn't open connection to gnuplot");
01736     }
01737 
01738     nplots = 0;
01739     valid = true;
01740     smooth = "";
01741 
01742     //set terminal type
01743     showonscreen();
01744 
01745     return;
01746 }
01747 
01748 
01749 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01750 //
01751 // Find out if a command lives in m_sGNUPlotPath or in PATH
01752 //
01753 bool Gnuplot::get_program_path()
01754 {
01755     //
01756     // first look in m_sGNUPlotPath for Gnuplot
01757     //
01758     std::string tmp = Gnuplot::m_sGNUPlotPath + "/" + 
01759         Gnuplot::m_sGNUPlotFileName;
01760 
01761 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(__TOS_WIN__)
01762     if ( Gnuplot::file_exists(tmp,0) ) // check existence
01763 #elif defined(unix) || defined(__unix) || defined(__unix__) || defined(__APPLE__)
01764     if ( Gnuplot::file_exists(tmp,1) ) // check existence and execution permission
01765 #endif
01766     {
01767         return true;
01768     }
01769 
01770 
01771     //
01772     // second look in PATH for Gnuplot
01773     //
01774     char *path;
01775     // Retrieves a C string containing the value of environment variable PATH
01776     path = getenv("PATH");
01777 
01778 
01779     if (path == NULL)
01780     {
01781         throw GnuplotException("Path is not set");
01782         return false;
01783     }
01784     else
01785     {
01786         std::list<std::string> ls;
01787 
01788         //split path (one long string) into list ls of strings
01789 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(__TOS_WIN__)
01790         stringtok(ls,path,";");
01791 #elif defined(unix) || defined(__unix) || defined(__unix__) || defined(__APPLE__)
01792         stringtok(ls,path,":");
01793 #endif
01794 
01795         // scan list for Gnuplot program files
01796         for (std::list<std::string>::const_iterator i = ls.begin(); 
01797                 i != ls.end(); ++i)
01798         {
01799             tmp = (*i) + "/" + Gnuplot::m_sGNUPlotFileName;
01800 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(__TOS_WIN__)
01801             if ( Gnuplot::file_exists(tmp,0) ) // check existence
01802 #elif defined(unix) || defined(__unix) || defined(__unix__) || defined(__APPLE__)
01803             if ( Gnuplot::file_exists(tmp,1) ) // check existence and execution permission
01804 #endif
01805             {
01806                 Gnuplot::m_sGNUPlotPath = *i; // set m_sGNUPlotPath
01807                 return true;
01808             }
01809         }
01810 
01811         tmp = "Can't find gnuplot neither in PATH nor in \"" + 
01812             Gnuplot::m_sGNUPlotPath + "\"";
01813         throw GnuplotException(tmp);
01814 
01815         Gnuplot::m_sGNUPlotPath = "";
01816         return false;
01817     }
01818 }
01819 
01820 
01821 
01822 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01823 //
01824 // check if file exists
01825 //
01826 bool Gnuplot::file_exists(const std::string &filename, int mode)
01827 {
01828     if ( mode < 0 || mode > 7)
01829     {
01830         throw std::runtime_error("In function \"Gnuplot::file_exists\": mode\
01831                 has to be an integer between 0 and 7");
01832         return false;
01833     }
01834 
01835     // int _access(const char *path, int mode);
01836     //  returns 0 if the file has the given mode,
01837     //  it returns -1 if the named file does not exist or is not accessible in 
01838     //  the given mode
01839     // mode = 0 (F_OK) (default): checks file for existence only
01840     // mode = 1 (X_OK): execution permission
01841     // mode = 2 (W_OK): write permission
01842     // mode = 4 (R_OK): read permission
01843     // mode = 6       : read and write permission
01844     // mode = 7       : read, write and execution permission
01845 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(__TOS_WIN__)
01846     if (_access(filename.c_str(), mode) == 0)
01847 #elif defined(unix) || defined(__unix) || defined(__unix__) || defined(__APPLE__)
01848     if (access(filename.c_str(), mode) == 0)
01849 #endif
01850     {
01851         return true;
01852     }
01853     else
01854     {
01855         return false;
01856     }
01857 
01858 }
01859 
01860 bool Gnuplot::file_available(const std::string &filename){
01861     std::ostringstream except;
01862     if( Gnuplot::file_exists(filename,0) ) // check existence
01863     {
01864         if( !(Gnuplot::file_exists(filename,4)) ){// check read permission
01865             except << "No read permission for File \"" << filename << "\"";
01866             throw GnuplotException( except.str() );
01867             return false;
01868         }
01869         else {
01870                 return true;
01871         }
01872     }
01873     else{
01874         except << "File \"" << filename << "\" does not exist";
01875         throw GnuplotException( except.str() );
01876         return false;
01877     }
01878 }
01879 
01880 
01881 
01882 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01883 //
01884 // Opens a temporary file
01885 //
01886 std::string Gnuplot::create_tmpfile(std::ofstream &tmp)
01887 {
01888 
01889 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(__TOS_WIN__)
01890     char name[] = "gnuplotiXXXXXX"; //tmp file in working directory
01891 #elif defined(unix) || defined(__unix) || defined(__unix__) || defined(__APPLE__)
01892     char name[] = "/tmp/gnuplotiXXXXXX"; // tmp file in /tmp
01893 #endif
01894 
01895     //
01896     // check if maximum number of temporary files reached
01897     //
01898     if (Gnuplot::tmpfile_num == GP_MAX_TMP_FILES - 1)
01899     {
01900         std::ostringstream except;
01901         except << "Maximum number of temporary files reached (" 
01902                << GP_MAX_TMP_FILES << "): cannot open more files" << std::endl;
01903 
01904         throw GnuplotException( except.str() );
01905         return "";
01906     }
01907 
01908     // int mkstemp(char *name);
01909     // shall replace the contents of the string pointed to by "name" by a unique
01910     // filename, and return a file descriptor for the file open for reading and 
01911     // writing.  Otherwise, -1 shall be returned if no suitable file could be 
01912     // created.  The string in template should look like a filename with six 
01913     // trailing 'X' s; mkstemp() replaces each 'X' with a character from the 
01914     // portable filename character set.  The characters are chosen such that the
01915     // resulting name does not duplicate the name of an existing file at the 
01916     // time of a call to mkstemp()
01917 
01918 
01919     //
01920     // open temporary files for output
01921     //
01922 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(__TOS_WIN__)
01923     if (_mktemp(name) == NULL)
01924 #elif defined(unix) || defined(__unix) || defined(__unix__) || defined(__APPLE__)
01925     if (mkstemp(name) == -1)
01926 #endif
01927     {
01928         std::ostringstream except;
01929         except << "Cannot create temporary file \"" << name << "\"";
01930         throw GnuplotException(except.str());
01931         return "";
01932     }
01933 
01934     tmp.open(name);
01935     if (tmp.bad())
01936     {
01937         std::ostringstream except;
01938         except << "Cannot create temporary file \"" << name << "\"";
01939         throw GnuplotException(except.str());
01940         return "";
01941     }
01942 
01943     //
01944     // Save the temporary filename
01945     //
01946     tmpfile_list.push_back(name);
01947     Gnuplot::tmpfile_num++;
01948 
01949     return name;
01950 }
01951 
01952 void Gnuplot::remove_tmpfiles(){
01953     if ((tmpfile_list).size() > 0)
01954     {
01955         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tmpfile_list.size(); i++)
01956             remove( tmpfile_list[i].c_str() );
01957 
01958         Gnuplot::tmpfile_num -= tmpfile_list.size();
01959     }
01960 }
01961 #endif
